intro: Aegiphila compacta, commonly known as the compact aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, often hairy leaves. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Aegiphila compacta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
